intro: Psychotria secundiflora, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow centers, which are arranged in clusters. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Psychotria secundiflora is also noted for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
